stories.text:
We're a small team based in the UK comprised of UX/UI/frontend/backend developers. We work exceptionally well together and over the past year we've built mobile apps, SPAs for our clients(who are people we mostly know). However how does one reach out for new contracts?

There's obviously plenty of jobs boards for lone developers but as a ready to go team, there appears to be a lack of options. We have no real sales/marketing experience, but just love building tech!
stories.title: Ask HN: How to get hired as a fully functional and working team?

stories.text:
I'd like to get into a career where I'm writing more architectural software. Something that involves writing libraries, frameworks, API's, runtime environments, software engines, those sorts of things.

I've been advertising myself as a C# developer for a while now, which I've come to realize is the world of enterprise GUI development, something I'm sick of.

I've tried advertising myself as a C++ developer, but all I find are embedded systems jobs (at a much smaller rate than C#) and I'd like to work from home.

I always hear people say, contribute to a project, but that doesn't sound like a promising way to make a stable living.
stories.title: Ask HN: What are some good languages for architectural jobs?
Is off-grid a viable option for everyday people?
